intro: Dryandra serra, commonly known as the serrated dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, cone-shaped inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, which give it its common name. Dryandra serra is adapted to grow in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in heathland environments. Its flowers are typically pink or red, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects.
